meanings.definition: Made up of a variety of colors or elements
meanings.sent1: The motly flowers in the garden brightened up the yard.
meanings.sent2: She wore a motly scarf that had stripes of different colors.
meanings.sent3: The motly painting looked like a rainbow had melted on the canvas.
meanings.sent4: The motly crowd at the concert resembled a patchwork quilt of people.
meanings.sent5: The motly balloons floating in the sky created a festive atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: The garage sale had a motly of items for sale.
meanings.sent2: He rummaged through the motly of tools in the toolbox.
meanings.sent3: The motly of toys in the playroom made it difficult to find a specific one.
meanings.sent4: The motly of books on the shelf seemed to tell a story of their own.
meanings.sent5: The motly of seashells on the beach was a treasure trove for collectors.
